Jannice Tan


Candidate for Treasurer


Watch video [1:45]
 
Close

Jannice Tan

Candidate for Treasurer

Watch video [1:45]

I am an active university student that has a strong passion in doing voluntary university activities. I am definitely the person you should call if you want to explore new challenges, and this has led me to the Sunway University Student Council. Not only that, I firmly believe that university life is not all about academics and achieving good results, but also about self-development and being an impact to the people around me. Because of that, I have decided to take a leap of faith and joined the Student Council in hopes of maximizing my time here in Sunway, and it has been 3 years since I’ve joined the Student Council. My desire to contribute to the university has given me the opportunity to participate in the planning of various events, both small and large-scaled. Though I have gained many fruitful experiences throughout the years, I know that I have yet to fully utilize my potential and that urges me to constantly seek for new opportunities to grow. Hence, I wish to grow myself as a person and give my best to this university by being the Treasurer of the Sunway University Student Council.

Show your support

  • Share on Facebook

Experiences

  • Executive Member, Sunway University Student Council 2015 – 2016
  • Student Ambassador & Teaching Assistant, Center for Asia Leadership (CAL); Harvard University Asia Centre; Asia Leadership Trek (Winter) 2016
  • Student Ambassador, International Symposium on Precision Medicine 2016
  • International Students Assistant Director, Sunway College Student Action Team (STACT) 2015
  • Executive Member, Sekretariat Rukun Negara 2015
  • Student Ambassador, Oxford University's 4th Southeast Asian Studies Symposium & Asian Economic Panel 2015
  • Student Committee, ASEAN Foundation 1st Model ASEAN Meeting
  • Volunteer, The 8th Kuala Lumpur Eco Film Fest (KLEFF) 2015
  • Participant, Student Entrepreneurial Experience Malaysia 2015
  • Student Ambassador, Global Movement Of Moderates Foundation (GMMF), Akademi Belia & Malaysia China Friendship Association Malaysia: Malaysia-China Youth Friendship Day 2014
  • Volunteer, MTV World Stage 2014

Manifesto

A public declaration of the policies, aims, and plans that I intend to execute if I am elected office.

Being transparent and accountable with council's funds. Ensure transparency and accountability with the handling of the funds assigned to the student council.
Avoiding the misuse of funds. Making sure that funds are safe and not misused for inappropriate reasons by keeping track of the inflow and outflow of cash meticulously.
Expand student council’s reach. Besides knowing and hearing of student council, it will be the first body that comes to mind when there’s an issue regarding university.
Creating a more fun and enjoyable university experience. Enabling the students to have a more holistic study experience is very important as they will not only develop in terms of academics but in terms of soft skills and so on.
Increasing the variability in activities for council members. Not only will being in student council improve the council member’s organizing skills but also enhance their leadership and personal development.
Eliminate the feeling of redundancy among council members. Helping the council members find purpose in serving the students with council again.
